metadata.Title: CVE-2020-8284 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
A malicious server can use the FTP PASV response to trick curl 7.73.0 and earlier into connecting back to a given IP address and port, and this way potentially make curl extract information about services that are otherwise private and not disclosed, for example doing port scanning and service banner extractions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8284` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.18
libcurl3 - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.18
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.18
libcurl3-nss - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.18
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.47.0-1ubuntu2.18').
